name: Yelloh! Village Le Brasilia

reviews.text: We chose La Brasilia because of its excellent reviews, its location and closeness to the beach and for the pools. The pools didn't disappoint, although they are very cold. the guards are on patrol the whole time and severely reprimanded a couple of lads for bombing down the slides, which nearly resulted in them being banned from the pool completely! they take their job very seriously, which is good I guess. To get a sunbed, you have to be there at 0945 and stampede with the serious sunworshippers when the gate opens at 10am! hilarious, although we only attempted it on one day. the rest of the fortnight we turned up when we felt like it and just put our towels out on the fake grass. There was always a spot somewhere. We stayed with Thomson Al Fresco and the pitch was a good size. The home was clean and well equiped although the staff, whilst very friendly, didn't seem to know much about the area and referred us to reception for most of our queries. There were plenty of parks around for our daughters to play in (age 7 and 5) and they loved the pools. There was a mini show every evening where the kids get up on stage and copy Barny, the entertainer. It was fun, although with the same hour of music every night at 8:20, it got a little tedious towards the end. The girls enjoyed it though, and we came home with the CD of the music! The beach is easily accessible from the site, although its not particularly child friendly, as it drops away after about 10ft from the edge, so you have to keep an eye on things at all times. We tended to go to the beach at Canet Plage, as this didn't drop away so quickly and you could go out further to paddle. The main downside to our holiday, was that the weather was quite windy (which I've been told is often the case in this area of france) and so the sand would blow up and whip your legs quite fiercly. it also made the pools seem colder when you got out of them. There was a water taxi over to Canet Plage, and also a road train but it worked out quite expensive if you had to do it every day (about 3 euro return). You really need a car, which we didn't get, opting for bikes instead. these were fun, although limiting with 2 young cyclists as to how far we could go.Good gym on site.all in all, would really recommend La Brasilia!! as long as you get the sun too.
reviews.title: Excellent Site - shame about the weather.

reviews.text: We have travelled to this region for many years and used to stay south of Perpignan in Argeles. However we decided to change sites and after a lot of research we came across Le Brasilia.
reviews.title: Fab -so sad to be home

reviews.text: From the moment we arrived I fell in love with the place. It was spotlessly clean, spacious, not too big and beautifully landscaped. I loved the little village square with its tabac, fruit and vegetables - which are all grown on the site and are v e r y fresh - bakery, supermarket, butcher / deli, and not forgetting the wine shop! There was also a clothes shop and gift shop. The lauderette was excellent with good quality machines. I loved being able to walk to the beach. At weekends the part of the beach around the restaurant Le Swim and lifeguards station got incredibly busy from locals. However if you walk onto the beach from deeper in the campsite you will find it quite empty.
reviews.title: Worse Campsite ever - Definitely not worthy of 5 star rating

reviews.text: We stayed with thompson Al Fresco and the problem was that our mobile was the last one right beside the fence with a very busy and noisy road only metres from us. Sometimes while eating dinner we had to stop talking while a particularly busy truck rumbled by. Therefore for this reason and this reason only - I would not book with Thompson again.
reviews.title: Great Time

reviews.text: I would really advise taking your own car or hiring a car to really appreciate the beauty of the area. We brought our own car and visited many local wine producers and came home with about 60 litres of wine. We went up in the Pyrenees and visited the very pretty town of Ceret for its Saturday market. Gorgeous fruit, vegetables, olives, cheese, spices and quirky street entertainment. You must visit Collioure as well as Villefranche de Conflent.
reviews.title: Wished we'd gone somewhere else...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Firstly, I think it would be very useful if reviewers stated the type of accommodation they stayed in. It is unfair to give this site a poor rating because you had a bad experience with your holiday rep (that is not the fault of the site).
reviews.title: Site with very good facilities and very clean

reviews.text: We stayed here in our motorhome. We did not have a reservation, but found the site staff extremely helpful and friendly. We were offered a sunny or shaded pitch. We opted for a sunny pitch which was a good size and included electric and water.
reviews.title: Another great holiday

reviews.text: We visited when the schools had just gone back. The site was very busy, but quiet.
reviews.title: I would not rush back

reviews.text: The pool complex, as other reviewers have mentioned, is very nice but only really suitable for families with small children. As 2 adults, it was not really suitable.
reviews.title: It was OK but won't go back because the pool was rubbish

reviews.text: The beach is directly accessed from the site which is handy. Having rentable sun loungers would have been useful, but the beach is very nice and very few people around.
reviews.title: Second year was even better than the first!

reviews.text: We stayed with Eurocamp at this resort. Family of four, with a 2yr old and 4yr old. The accommodation was great and well spaced. It was quiet at the beginning of the season but we didn't feel that anything was lacking. The beach was quite grubby and very windy but the resort pools were meticulously clean and the heated toddler pools were great for children and adults alike. The animations team were very entertaining and appeared to really enjoy their work and were happy to engage our 2 eager yet surprisingly timid children.
reviews.title: Fab holiday, fab facilities, fab staff!

reviews.text: We have just arrived home after a 3 night stay at Le Brasilia. I was unsure of the quality having read the reviews on this web site, however I can tell you the site is excellent. It was the first weekend of the season opening and often you expect lots of small problems.. but frankly it was superb. The park is in a great location next to the beach, the pool is wonderful for children and adults alike, the staff went out of their way (thanks especially to the Kids Club team and to all those involved with the shows, which were great fun!) ... we stayed in the Sud area, in a brand new mobile home that was very comfortable.
reviews.title: Le Brasilia is EXCELLENT

reviews.text: We are already looking to return to the same park this summer - so congratulations to Le Brasilia team. You should be proud of the quality of the park, accommodation and value for money.
reviews.title: We've been 4 times!
Excellent Parc
reviews.text: I thought I should add our review as I have read some really unfair negative reviews on this camp site.

We first visited Le Brasilia four years ago when the weather was terrible at home - we booked a last minute 6 day break - jumped in the car and drove down! Our first two visits were before the new renovations - admittedly we went right at the end of August on the first visit so the site was emptying out but we loved every single minute and as soon as we returned home we booked for the following year.
reviews.title: First time in Brasilia..the good far outways the bad.. sept 2011
